meanings.definition: To retract a wish or desire.
meanings.sent1: After blowing out the birthday candles, she unwished for a pony.
meanings.sent2: She quickly unwished for the expensive gift once she realized the cost.
meanings.sent3: He unwished for a million dollars, but only got a penny instead.
meanings.sent4: The magician unwished the rabbit back into the hat.
meanings.sent5: The genie granted her wish, but she immediately unwished it.

meanings.sent1: The uninterested boy had an unwishing expression on his face.
meanings.sent2: She had an unwishing attitude towards the party, preferring to stay home.
meanings.sent3: The unwishing cat refused to play with the new toy.
meanings.sent4: His unwishing nature made it difficult for others to surprise him.
meanings.sent5: The unwishing student avoided participating in any activities.
